required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Correlation Between Ultrasonography Based Muscle Architecture Parameters and Voluntary Isometric Muscle Strength
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Correlation Between Ultrasonography Based Muscle Architecture Parameters and Maximum Voluntary Isometric Knee Flexor Muscle Strength

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to investigate potential relations of ultrasound-based muscle architecture parameters and isometric knee flexor muscle strength (IKFS) in healthy individuals. IKFS was measured for twenty participants (22.15±2.41 y.o; 8 females, 12 males) by a hand-held dynamometer. Investigated parameters were total and individual cross-sectional areas (CSA), Muscle-Thickness (MT), and pennation-angle (PA) for Biceps Femoris-long head (LBF), Semitendinosus (ST) and Semimembranosus (SM) muscles at 25%, 50% and 75% length of the thigh.

detailed_description.textblock:
The images of hamstring muscles were taken by a US device (Toshiba Aplio 500, Japan) with a linear probe (10-12 MHz, with a footprint of 52 mm).
For each participant, maximum voluntary IKFS was measured from the non-dominant side in the prone position with foot and ankle stayed outside of the bed. Maximum IKFS (20 limbs) was measured by an HHD (A Lafayette Model 01165) (Lafayette, IN) at 15° knee flexion in prone lying position

primary_outcome.measure: The association between IKFS and ultrasound-based muscle architecture in this study will investigate potential relations of ultrasound-based muscle architecture parameters and isometric knee flexor muscle strength (IKFS) in healthy individuals.
primary_outcome.description: IKFS was measured for twenty participants by a hand-held dynamometer. Investigated parameters were total and individual cross-sectional areas (CSA), Muscle-Thickness (MT), and pennation-angle (PA) for Biceps Femoris-long head (LBF), Semitendinosus (ST) and Semimembranosus (SM) muscles at 25%, 50% and 75% length of the thigh. The association between IKFS and ultrasound-based muscle architecture parameters was assessed.

intervention.intervention_name: muscle strength and ultrasound imaging measurement
intervention.description: hamstring muscle strenght measured by hand held dynamometer. The long head of Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembronosus were evaluated by B-mode ultrasound imaging.

study_pop.textblock: Twenty healthy participants (22.15 ± 2.41 y.o; 1.72 ± 0.09 m; 66.5 ± 11.50 kg; 8 female, 12 male) participated in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- being healthy young
Exclusion Criteria:
-
